title: 10-Minute Tech Comm Podcast Episode
description: It’s no surprise that I think professional portfolios are important. If your profession or skill lends itself to this modality, it’s a method to not only display samples of work (whether you’re actively looking for jobs or not), but also an opportunity to perform the skills that your resume says you have. For me, every choice—even of omission—is a thoughtful, rhetorical one. Listen and let me know what you think!

title: Platform Trailer Manual
description: While serving as Sr. Technical Writer at ProWrite Inc., East Manufacturing contracted us to update their trailer manual. To complete the project, we met with their Subject Matter Experts (SMEs), reformatted the manual to aid comprehension and edited the manual for language, grammar, and consistency.

title: J&J MedTech Instructions For Use (IFU)
description: Ethicon Endo-Surgery, Inc. (EES), a Johnson & Johnson company, designs and manufactures medical devices.  As the technical writing intern for EES’ Global Packaging and Labeling Solutions (GPLS) team, I was tasked with creating an Instructions For Use (IFU) for a new medical device, the Enseal G2 Articulating Tissue Sealer. I collaborated with members of the Quality Assurance, Preclinical, R&D, Regulatory, Packaging, and Marketing departments to develop new content for the IFU that was submitted to the FDA.
